intro: Racosperma gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellow or pale green flowers. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma gardneri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
